security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate media downloader skill. All 66 external command calls use hardcoded arguments for trusted tools (yt-dlp, ffmpeg). Environment variable access is for optional API keys to stock media services (Pexels, Unsplash, Pixabay). Filesystem operations are scoped to a dedicated downloads directory. No command injection or credential exfiltration patterns found.

high_findings.title: subprocess.run External Command Execution
high_findings.description: Multiple subprocess.run calls detected for yt-dlp, ffmpeg, and ffprobe commands
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: All subprocess.run calls use hardcoded command arrays with no user input. Arguments are fixed strings for trusted media tools. This is legitimate tool invocation for video download and processing.

high_findings.title: Environment Variable Access for API Keys
high_findings.description: Code reads PEXELS_API_KEY, UNSPLASH_ACCESS_KEY, and PIXABAY_API_KEY from environment
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Standard pattern for credential management. Keys are optional and read from environment for accessing legitimate stock media APIs. No exfiltration or hardcoded secrets found.

low_findings.title: Network Requests to Stock Media APIs
low_findings.description: HTTP requests to Pexels, Unsplash, and Pixabay APIs for searching and downloading media
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Legitimate API calls to authorized stock photo and video services. Required functionality for the media downloader skill.

low_findings.title: Filesystem Operations in Downloads Directory
low_findings.description: File write and read operations for downloaded media files
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Legitimate file operations scoped to a dedicated downloads directory. Uses os.path.join and controlled paths for safe file handling.

content.value_statement: Finding and downloading images and videos from stock photo services and YouTube is time-consuming and requires multiple tools. This skill automates media search and download with support for video trimming.
actual_capabilities: Search and download images from Pexels, Unsplash, and Pixabay using natural language queries
Search and download stock videos from Pexels and Pixabay
Download videos from YouTube with yt-dlp
Trim downloaded or existing videos to specific duration using ffmpeg
Auto-trim videos to target length from the middle point
limitations: Requires API keys for Pexels, Unsplash, and Pixabay to search and download stock media
Requires yt-dlp and ffmpeg to be installed for YouTube and video processing features
Cannot download from platforms other than YouTube without API support
Does not support downloading playlists or channels in batch mode

use_cases.title: Content Creator - Find Stock Media
use_cases.description: Search for and download royalty-free images and videos for your projects without visiting multiple stock photo websites.

use_cases.title: Video Editor - YouTube Clips
use_cases.description: Download YouTube video clips and trim them to specific timestamps for use in your video editing workflow.

use_cases.title: Developer - Media Automation
use_cases.description: Automate media downloading tasks in scripts and workflows using the command-line interface.

best_practices: Set up API keys for Pexels, Unsplash, and Pixabay before use to enable stock media features
Install yt-dlp and ffmpeg system dependencies for YouTube and video trimming support
Use the --duration flag to limit video length when downloading stock videos
Use the --output flag to specify a custom download directory for your project
anti_patterns: Do not use this skill to download copyrighted content without proper licensing
Do not share your API keys in conversations or scripts that may be logged
Do not attempt to download from platforms that prohibit automated access
Do not rely on this skill for time-sensitive news content from YouTube

faq.question: Do I need API keys to use this skill?
faq.answer: API keys are optional for Pexels, Unsplash, and Pixabay. Without keys, you can still use YouTube download and video trimming features. Keys enable stock image and video search.

faq.question: What dependencies are required?
faq.answer: Install yt-dlp with pip and ffmpeg system-wide for YouTube downloads and video trimming. Run 'pip install yt-dlp' and install ffmpeg from your package manager.

faq.question: Can I download entire YouTube playlists?
faq.answer: This skill is designed for individual video downloads. For playlists, use yt-dlp directly with playlist-specific options.

faq.question: Where are files downloaded?
faq.answer: Files download to a 'downloads' folder in the skill directory by default. Use the --output or -o flag to specify a custom directory.

faq.question: What video formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill downloads MP4 by default and can trim any video format that ffmpeg supports. Use --audio-only to extract audio as MP3.

faq.question: Is the downloaded content free to use?
faq.answer: Stock media from Pexels, Unsplash, and Pixabay is royalty-free. YouTube downloads are subject to YouTube's terms. Check licensing before commercial use.
